metadata.title: CVE-2021-46954 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:net/sched: sch_frag: fix stack OOB read while fragmenting IPv4 packets when'act_mirred' tries to fragment IPv4 packets that had been previouslyre-assembled using 'act_ct', splats like the following can be observed onkernels built with KASAN: BUG: KASAN: stack-out-of-bounds inip_do_fragment+0x1b03/0x1f60 Read 00 00 00 00 00 00 00ffff888147009600: 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 f2 f2 f2 for IPv4packets, sch_fragment() uses a temporary struct dst_entry. Then, in thefollowing call graph: ip_do_fragment() ip_skb_dst_mtu()ip_dst_mtu_maybe_forward() ip_mtu_locked() the pointer to struct dst_entryis used as pointer to struct rtable: this turns the access to structmembers like rt_mtu_locked into an OOB read in the stack. Fix this changingthe temporary variable used for IPv4 packets in sch_fragment(), similarlyto what is done for IPv6 few lines below.
